comment: Nice guy, but a terrible professor. The midterm, final, and quizzes are insanely difficult, lectures are confusing and hard to follow with few example problems worked out, and the labs and homework are graded harshly. If you want to keep your sanity, PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

He is very difficult to work with. Nice guy but not good professor. Quizzes were terrible, he had us physically write a bunch of Matlab code on earlier quizzes. Labs weren't that bad. Harsh grader. Pulls his questions from textbook. I would not take this professor. Too much unnecessary stress.

Don't take this guy unless you absolutely have to. Class is a hot mess, super difficult quizzes that aren't even taken during lecture time. The class severely lacks structure, he has never taught lecture before and is a tough grader. He is part time with no office hours and there is literally zero tutoring at KSU for this course, good luck!

quizzes are insanely hard, he expects us to memorize the syntax for matlab, cool guy but sucks at teaching. Takes up lab time to do the quizzes. His lectures don't make any sense and provides up so many problems and grade us insanely harsh.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Cool guy with industry experience but lacks teaching ability. Assignments, lectures, etc. are often unclear and iterated upon 5+ times including completely being changed. Lectures are poorly organized and quizzes are taken outside of class hours. Accent present but generally non problematic. Lots and lots of words with almost no meaning

Lab instructor for Hai Ho's EE4201 in Fall 2024. Graded the labs inconsistently and harshly. After numerous complaints and Hai Ho having to have a talk with him, it improved.

Was very lenient about regrading and extending the due date of labs though. I just wish he didn't grade us like grad students. 

I pity those who will take him for lecture.
